Package bridges.model

Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • bridges.model.GameModel
  • public class GameModel
extends java.util.Observable
    An observable, thread save game model that provides the functionality of - bridges.game and - bridges.util

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts the current game.

      • nextStep

        public boolean nextStep()
        Executes the next solve step.
        Returns:
        true, if a new step could be executed, false, if not.

      • generate

        public void generate​(int width,
                     int height,
                     int islandCount)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a new board.
        Parameters:
        width - - The width of the new board.
        height - - The height of the new board.
        islandCount - - The Island count of the new board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid parameters have been given.

      • load

        public void load​(java.lang.String filename)
          throws BoardReader.SyntaxException,
                 BoardReader.SemanticException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Load a new board from the given filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - This full path and filename of the file to load.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O-Error while reading the given file.
        BoardReader.SemanticException - If the file content had semantical errors.
        BoardReader.SyntaxException - If the file content had syntactical errors.

      • save

        public void save​(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save the current board to the given filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - - the file to save the board to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be written.

      • getBridges

        public java.util.List<Bridge> getBridges()
        Return all bridges of the board.
        Returns:
        A list of all bridges on the board.

      • getBridges

        public java.util.List<Bridge> getBridges​(Island island)
        Return all bridges, that include the given island.
        Parameters:
        island - - the island, all bridges must include.
        Returns:
        A list of all bridges on the board, which include the given island.

      • getBridges

        public java.util.List<Bridge> getBridges​(Island island,
                                         Direction dir)
        Return all bridges, that include the given island and are build in the given direction
        Parameters:
        island - - the island, all bridges must include.
        dir - - the direction, the bridges must be built in.
        Returns:
        A list of all bridges on the board, which include the given island in the given direction.

        public boolean isValid​(Bridge bridge)
        Check, if the given bridge can be added to the board.
        Parameters:
        bridge - - the bridge, that is to be added.
        Returns:
        true, if the bridge can be added, false otherwise.

        Return the state of the current board.
        Returns:
        The state of the board.
        See Also:
        BoardState

      • removeOneBridge

        public void removeOneBridge​(Bridge bridge)
        Remove a single bridge from the board, which covers the given bridge. This will make a double bridge into a single bridge and completely remove a single bridge.

        Note: The isDouble attribute of the bridge parameter is ignored.
        Parameters:
        bridge - - The bridge, which is to be removed.

      • addBridge

        public void addBridge​(Bridge bridge)
        Add the given bridge to the board (or do nothing).
        Parameters:
        bridge - - the bridge to be added to the board.

      • getIslandAt

        public Island getIslandAt​(int x,
                          int y)
        Returns the island at the given coordinates or null.
        Parameters:
        x - - the x coordinate of the island.
        y - - the y coordinate of the island.
        Returns:
        The island at the given coordinates or null.

      • createBridge

        public Bridge createBridge​(Island island,
                           Direction dir)
        Return a bridge, which starts at the given island an goes into the given direction (or null). Note: This only creates the bridge. It is _not_ added to the board.
        Parameters:
        island - - The Island to start from.
        dir - - The Direction to go into.
        Returns:
        A new Bridge object or null.

      • merge

        public void merge​(java.lang.String leftFile,
                  java.lang.String rightFile)
           throws BoardReader.SyntaxException,
                  BoardReader.SemanticException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Merge the puzzles given by the filenames left and right.
        Parameters:
        leftFile - The puzzle, that will be present on the left of the new puzzle.
        rightFile - The puzzle, that will be present on the right of the new puzzle.
        Throws:
        BoardReader.SyntaxException
        BoardReader.SemanticException
        java.io.IOException
